meanings.definition: Obtain goods or services from an outside supplier.
meanings.sent1: The company outsourced their customer service to a call center in another city.
meanings.sent2: Many businesses choose to outsource their IT support to specialized companies.
meanings.sent3: The small bakery outsourced their bread production to a local farmer, who grew the wheat and baked the loaves.
meanings.sent4: She outsourced the task of organizing the event to her efficient assistant, who handled everything smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing the project to a team of experts ensured high-quality results and saved time.

meanings.definition: Contract work out to an outside firm.
meanings.sent1: The construction company outsourced the plumbing work to a reliable contractor.
meanings.sent2: When the workload increased, the manager decided to outsource some tasks to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The artist outsourced the painting of backgrounds to a talented friend, allowing her to focus on the main subjects.
meanings.sent4: Outsourcing the design work to a creative agency brought fresh ideas and perspectives to the project.
meanings.sent5: She outsourced the catering for the event to a renowned chef, ensuring delicious food for the guests.

meanings.definition: Transfer a business activity or function to another company.
meanings.sent1: The company outsourced their payroll processing to a specialized firm.
meanings.sent2: To reduce costs, the organization decided to outsource their marketing department.
meanings.sent3: The bookstore outsourced their bookkeeping to a local accountant, freeing up time for the owner to focus on customers.
meanings.sent4: Outsourcing the production of components to a factory overseas helped the company meet demand quickly.
meanings.sent5: She outsourced the delivery services to a reliable courier company, ensuring timely shipments to customers.
